node.title: New freedoms for fully vaccinated Queenslanders once state reaches COVID-19 vaccine milestone
node.alt: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk at a COVID-19 update
node.description: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk saysÂ there will be greater freedoms granted to fully vaccinated Queenslanders from next month.
node.content:
["Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk has announced there will be greater freedoms granted to Queenslanders fully vaccinated against COVID-19 from next month.", "The measures take effect from December 17, or once the state reaches 80 per cent of the Queensland population 16 years and over being fully vaccinated.", "The Premier said pubs, clubs, nightclubs, hotels, restaurants and music venues will be free from all restrictions provided all patrons and staff are fully vaccinated.", "There will be no limit on weddings where all the guests are fully vaccinated, with police set to enforce requirements for venues.", "Only fully vaccinated people will be able to visit hospitals, aged care facilities, prisons and disability services, except in end-of-life or emergency situations.", "Mask restrictions where you can socially distance will also lift once the first\u00a0dose rate hits 80 per cent, which is expected today or tomorrow.", "Ms Palaszczuk said people who have done the right thing deserve to be compensated.", "\"Today we are taking another small but important step on our road to keeping our freedoms,\" she said.", "\"I've always said, as Premier, I am determined to unite Queenslanders and we have been united in our fight against this Delta virus.", "\"But now we need to all be united in our effort to get vaccinated.", "Acting Chief Health Officer Peter Aitken warned the freedoms and reopened borders would bring a wave of new COVID-19 cases.", "\"New South Wales reports show that if you are unvaccinated you are 16 times more likely to be admitted to ICU or die,\" Dr Aitken said.", "\"We don't want that to happen to Queenslanders, we want Queenslanders to come forward and get vaccinated.", "\"And I'll just finish with the same message: if you've got symptoms, get tested.\"", "
'It's not too late'
", "Deputy Premier Steven Miles said it was important to give businesses confidence leading into Christmas.", "\"We said we would consult with business and industry about how to implement these kinds of rewards and we have listened to that feedback in developing the plan that we are outlining,\" he said.", "He added there was still time for those who are not vaccinated to get the jab.", "\"I tell everyone who's not on their vaccination journey, that's 20 per cent\u00a0of eligible adults, it's not too late.", "\"There is plenty of time this week to go and start getting vaccinated, get your first vaccination.", "\"And so from the 17th of December, you'll be able to enjoy the same rewards as all of these other Queenslanders.\""]
